#Text=Pensacola Beach
#Text=Pensacola Beach
#Text=is a city in West Florida on Santa Rosa Island , a 40-mile barrier island .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Pensacola Beach is an independent community from its neighbor , Pensacola .
#Text=It is unincorporated and administered by Escambia County .

#Text=The eight and one-quarter square miles of land that comprise Pensacola Beach was originally owned by the United States Department of the Interior , but was deeded to Escambia County in 1947 , on the condition that the land would never be sold .
#Text=As a result , there are no property owners in the community , only long-term leaseholders .
#Text=There is some antipathy between mainland residents and Pensacola Beach leaseholders over tax issues related to the unique situation .
#Text=During the city of Pensacola 's early history , Indian attacks forced the fledgling settlement to relocate from the mainland to Pensacola Beach , near modern day Fort Pickens , in 1722 .
#Text=Although this protected the settlers from attack , it left them highly exposed to hurricanes , which eventually forced them back to the mainland in 1752 .
#Text=Most of Pensacola Beach and Santa Rosa Island 's modern history began with Fort Pickens , completed in 1834 and used continually until after World War II .
#Text=In 1971 , the coastal land east and west of the community , still owned by the United States government , was designated part of the Gulf Islands National Seashore .
#Text=Visitor information
#Text=Pensacola Beach Visitor Information Center
#Text=, 7 Casino Beach Boardwalk , ☏ + 1 850 932-1500 .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Pensacola International Airport
#Text=is 10 miles north of Pensacola Beach and is served by six airlines .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Pensacola , take the Pensacola Bay Bridge to Gulf Breeze , and turn right at the giant Pensacola Beach swordfish sign , seen in the photo above .
#Text=There 's a small toll of $ 1 to enter the community .
#Text=From Navarre Beach and points east , follow Hwy 98 to Gulf Breeze , then take the onramp to Pensacola Beach Rd .
#Text=J. Earle
#Text=Bowden Way is a scenic beach road that connects Pensacola Beach with Navarre Beach .
#Text=It 's a backdoor route into Pensacola Beach , with no toll .
#Text=The speed limit is restricted to 35 mph , and the road quality is poor .
#Text=By bus
#Text=ECAT
#Text=, 1515 W Fairfield Dr , ☏ +1850 595-3228 .
#Text=M - Sa 7:55AM-5:15PM , Su closed , exact times depend on route .
#Text=Based in Pensacola , ECAT sends one bus to Pensacola Beach , twice a day .

#Text=From Pensacola , you can board the bus either at the main transfer center , on Fairfield Dr , or from the Park -n- Trolley parking lot downtown , underneath the I-110 overpass , across from the Pensacola Civic Center .
#Text=The bus to Pensacola Beach leaves the transfer center at 7:55AM , and leaves the Park -n- Trolley at 8AM ; it arrives at the Pensacola Beach visitor center at 8:20AM .
#Text=The bus back to Pensacola leaves the Visitor Center at 4:30PM , and arrives at 5:10PM .
#Text=$ 2.35 one-way. .
#Text=By bicycle
#Text=Some hotels on the island offer bicycle rentals for their guests , but if you 're not staying on the island , you 'll have to bring your own bike .
#Text=If you 're taking the ECAT bus to the island , you can bring your bike on one of their bicycle racks .
#Text=A bicycle is a great way to get around the island quickly while still taking time to see the sights and enjoy the sun .
#Text=And if you get tired of cycling around , the free beach trolleys on the island are equipped with bike racks , so you can give your legs a rest .

#Text=For visitors to Fort Pickens , a bicycle is the next-best option to renting a boat ; you can ride most of the seven miles to the fort along the broken road , although there is a half-mile of sand you 'll have to walk across .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Pensacola Beach is easy to explore by boat .
#Text=Boat rentals
#Text=are available on the island , or from Pensacola and Gulf Breeze , and you have a wide variety of craft to choose from .
#Text=Kayaks , parasails , motorboats , sailboats , yachts , pontoon boats and waverunners are all available for rent .
#Text=If you own your own boat , there are plenty of marinas and docks around the island , which offer short-term , overnight , and long-term mooring .
#Text=Your hotel , if you 're staying at the island , might even pick up the tab .
#Text=From Pensacola Beach , it 's just a short boat ride to the cities of Pensacola , Gulf Breeze , or Navarre .
#Text=Just remember , the Escambia County Sheriff 's Office does have police boats patrolling the water , and they wo n't hesitate to pull you over for unsafe boating .
#Text=Drinking while boating is a big no-no here , and there is a zero tolerance policy for violators .
#Text=If you do n't have the skill or the will to captain your own boat , you can charter a boat .
#Text=This can be expensive , running up to $ 200 an hour , but it 's a great way to deep sea fish or scuba dive .
#Text=Due to the closing of Fort Pickens Road , many boat captains are offering reduced rates for visitors to Fort Pickens ; these usually start around $ 25 a person .

#Text=Some of the more expensive resorts on the island offer complimentary boat taxis , which will take you to the popular beaches , the boardwalk , or across Santa Rosa Sound to golf resorts in Gulf Breeze .
#Text=By car
#Text=Santa Rosa Island is a narrow , elongated island .
#Text=The two main roads , which run along the island 's length , are Fort Pickens Road and Via de Luna Drive .
#Text=Parking lots are available all over the island , and parking is free and plentiful .
#Text=However , on exceptionally busy weekends , the main parking lot for the Portofino Boardwalk and Casino Beach may fill up .
#Text=There 's usually alternate parking available at the hotels or restaurants .
#Text=Resist the urge to park along the side of the road ; the fine sand on the beaches can easily ensnare cars .
#Text=There is no vehicle access to Fort Pickens or Opal Beach .
#Text=There 's a parking lot just outside the entrance gates , but if you want to any further , you 'll have to hoof it , or find another way .
#Text=By foot
#Text=Most of the attractions of Pensacola Beach can be visited by foot , and Casino Beach is conveniently close to all the major restaurants , shopping , hotels , and the Portofino Boardwalk .
#Text=Sidewalks are available on most ( but because of storm damage , not all ) of the island .
